properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: Pump station improvements to meet a 4.2 mgd peak wet weather flow.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 132 (Berwick Trail Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required
properties.scope: An upgraded pump station capable of meeting peak flows of 7.5 mgd, along with approximately 5,000 linear feet of force main upgrades. Note force main improvements are not shown on the figure.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 110 (Loves Branch Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: An upgraded pump station capable of meeting peak flows of 11 mgd, along with approximately 4,900 linear feet of force main upgrades.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 106 (Vandiver Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: A new 6-MG equalization tank with a new 15 mgd wet weather pump station.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 000 (Brick Church Pike)

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. A portion of the project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: A new 3 MG equalization tank with a new 7 mgd wet weather pump station.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 114 (Davidson Branch Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: Pump station upgrade to meet a 4.8 mgd peak wet weather flow, upgrade of one force main (5,400 ft) to be dedicated to wet weather conveyance to Berwick Trail, and a new force main (7,100 ft) to convey flow to the Gibson Creek EQ.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 117 (Neely's Bend Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Project sizing is contingent upon the effectivenes of rehabilitation upstream.
properties.scope: Approximately 7,300 linear feet of gravity pipe replacement, increasing diameters ranging from 10 inches to 30 inches to a range of 12 inches to 36 inches.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 226 (Cowan Street Relief Bleeder)

properties.considerations: Project is contingent upon the effectivenes of rehabilitation upstream.
properties.scope: Pump station upgrade to meet a 15 mgd peak wet weather flow and increased force main capacity for approximately 700 linear feet to the existing manifold force main system.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 226 (Cowan Street Relief Bleeder)

properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Sewer rehabilitation of up to 48,000 linear feet of gravity sewer and any associated manholes and service connections.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 374 (Foster Avenue), 000 (2932 Louise Drive)

properties.considerations: Project from Capacity Assurance Program. Needed in conjunction with LaVernge improvements.
properties.scope: Gravity pipe replacement project of approximately 7,100 linear feet, increasing pipe diameters to 24 inches from an existing range of 15 inches to 21 inches.
properties.objective: This project was developed to address anticipated growth requirements (Capacity Assurance Program).

properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Sewer rehabilitation of up to 12,000 linear feet of gravity sewer and any associated manholes and service connections.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 189 (Langford Farms Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Significant easement and permit acquisition / coordination is required. Complex routing considerations, including extensive long and short tunnels. Signficant flow diversion issues. Mill Creek is habitat to the Nashville Crayfish, an endangered species.
properties.scope: Conveyance upgrade project of approximately 31,500 linear feet along Mill Creek, increasing diameters of one of the existing parallel mains ranging from 54 inches to 78 inches to a range of 72 to 108 inches.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 130 (Brown's Creek Pump Station), 000 (501 Bismark), 000 (408/412 Hollydale Dr.)

properties.considerations: Project sizing is contingent upon the effectivenes of rehabilitation upstream. Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: An upgraded pump station capable of meeting peak flows of 2.5 mgd, along with approximately 3,900 linear feet of force main upgrades.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 134 (Riverside Drive Pump Station)

properties.considerations: The rehabilitation in this area will likely be divided into four smaller projects.
properties.scope: Sewer rehabilitation of up to 174,000 linear feet of gravity sewer and any associated manholes and service connections.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 102 (Smith Springs Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Two potential crossings of Eillington Parkway.
properties.scope: Replacement or realignment of approximately 1,250 linear feet of 21-inch sewer.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed as part of the Long Term Control Plan improvements.

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain. Coordination with work in Public Works' complex.
properties.scope: A new 4-MG equalization tank with a new 81 mgd wet weather CSO pump station and approximately 700 linear feet of 72-inch influent gravity sewer with new relocated regulator construction.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Benedict & Crutcher CSO to two in a typical year.

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Coordination with Metro Parks and neighborhood associations.
properties.scope: A new 1 MG equalization tank with a new 23 mgd wet weather CSO pump station and approximately 3,000 linear feet of 36-inch force main to the EQ tank with regulator replacement.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Boscobel CSO to near zero in a typical year.

properties.project name: Central Wastewater Treatment Plant Equalization  - Phase I
properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: A new 13-MG cast-in-place, reinforced concrete equalization facility, open top with multiple cells. Includes 54-inch brick sewer relocation, 60-inch force main extension, canopy weather protection, and appurtences.
properties.objective: This project is is one of several being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Kerrigan CSO to nine in a typical year.

properties.project name: Central Wastewater Treatment Plant Grit and Pump Station Upgrade
properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Two new 40-mgd pumps, coarse screens, fine screens, grit collection equipment, and grit disposal equipment within the existing Central Pumping Station and the Central Wastewater Treatment Plant Equalization - Phase I.
properties.objective: This project is is one of several being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Kerrigan CSO to nine in a typical year.

properties.project name: Central Wastewater Treatment Plant Equalization  - Phase II
properties.considerations: Scope may be adjusted to reflect recommendations from the Central WWTP Optimization Study, which is currently underway.
properties.scope: A new 7-MG equalization facility at grade with four 20 mgd submersible pumps, weather canopy, and 60-inch force main to compost site with drainage pump station.
properties.objective: This project is is one of several being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Kerrigan CSO to nine in a typical year.

properties.project name: Central Wastewater Treatment Plant Optimization and Equalization Conversion
properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Conversion of existing plant tanks to 5 MG equalization basin for combined sewer system flows, replacement of manual sluice gates with electrical actuators, and other miscellaneous improvements at the Central wastewater treatment plant.
properties.objective: This project is is one of several being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Kerrigan CSO to nine in a typical year.

properties.project name: Central Wastewater Treatment Plant Equalization  - Phase III
properties.considerations: Scope may be adjusted to reflect recommendations from the Central WWTP Optimization Study, which is currently underway.
properties.scope: A new 15-MG equalization facility at grade.
properties.objective: This project is is one of several being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Kerrigan CSO to nine in a typical year.

properties.project name: Combined Sewer System and First Avenue Tunnel Rehabilitation
properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Rehabilitation of the existing 72-inch First Avenue Tunnel and other various combined sewer system rehabilitation, as identified.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed as part of the Long Term Control Plan improvements.

properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Installation of four deep access, maintenance shaft large diameter manholes to the existing First Avenue Tunnel.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed as part of the Long Term Control Plan improvements.

properties.considerations: Project is on the Cumberland River and must consider extreme river stages. Army Corps of Engneers permit required.
properties.scope: Replacement of existing facility with a new, hardened, marine-based combined sewer overflow floatables control device with spud piles mooring system and appurtences.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed as part of the Long Term Control Plan improvements.

properties.considerations: Difficult construction conditions and limited technology to apply in extreme flows.
properties.scope: Modification of the existing wall weir by adding an actuated dynamic weir.
properties.objective: This project is is one of several being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Kerrigan CSO to nine in a typical year.

properties.considerations: Scope of project is dependent on water balance and improvements for Centennial Park Master Plan.
properties.scope: Stormwater detention and other improvements, partial sewer separation, and combined sewer system rehabiltation and other improvements.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed as part of the Long Term Control Plan improvements.

properties.considerations: Land/easement acquisition from Tennessee State University is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain.
properties.scope: A new 3.2 MG equalization tank with a new 32 mgd wet weather CSO pump station.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to reduce the frequency of overflows at the Schrader CSO to two in a typical year.

properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Approximately 2,600 linear feet of gravity conveyance upgrades, increasing in diameter from 8 inches to a range of 12 inches to 18 inches.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 132 (Berwick Trail Pump Station)

properties.considerations: Project is adjacent to and crosses Dry Creek. Army Corps of Engineers permit will likely be required. Work terminates at WWTP. Sewer crosses Myatt Drive.
properties.scope: Approximately 1,400 linear feet of gravity conveyance upgrades, increasing in diameter from a range of 42 inches to 48 inches to a range of 48 inches to 60 inches.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 109 (Dry Creek Pump Station)

properties.considerations: None currently identified.
properties.scope: Approximately 3,900 linear feet of gravity conveyance upgrades, increasing in diameter from 8 inches to a range of 12 inches to 15 inches.
properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 327 (Norman Dr & Vantrease)

properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required. Project site is in the 100-year floodplain with a portion of the site in the floodway.

properties.objective: This project is being constructed to address the following overflows: 112 (Gibson Creek), 117 (Neely's Bend Pump Station), 132 (Berwick Trail Pump Station)

properties.considerations: None currently identified.

properties.project name: Mill Creek / Opryland Equalization Facility - Phase III
properties.considerations: Land acquisition is required.
properties.scope: Four 15 MG equalization storage tanks along with a wet weather pump station with 100 mgd peak pumping capacity.
